intro: Stenopadus colveei, commonly known as the Andean velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, thriving in cool and moist environments. Its botanical features include hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in its native climate. Stenopadus colveei is often found in cloud forests and is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to high-altitude conditions.
